content: dad hat materials needed yarn 70g dk weight yarn sizes mediu m 22-24 head measurement large 24-26 head measurement needles 20cm/8 3 5mm/us 4 circular needles 20cm/8 4mm/us 6 circular needles gauge in body pattern 4x1 6 stitches x 7 5 row unstretched 4-5 stitches stretched instructions using smaller needles 3 5mm/us4 cast on 120 130 stitches joining to knit in the round abbreviations knit in 1x1 rib for 2 5 /6cm k knit p purl switching to larger needles 4mm/us6 knit one row on the larger needle start the body of ribbing of in repeats of k4 p1 continue knitting like this in the round until the hat measures 6 5 /16 5cm 7 /18cm then start the decreases for the crown k2 k2tog p1 for one round 96 104 stitches remain on the next round knit in pattern k3 p1 for this round k1 k2tog p1 for one round 72 76 stitches remain knit next round in pattern k2 p1 k2tog p1 for one round 48 50 stitches remain knit next round in pattern k1 p1 for size m k2tog for one round this will take in the remaining purl stitches 24 stitches remain k all next round k2tog for one round 12 stitches remain k2tog again for one last round 6 stitches re- maining for size l k2tog x 12 you will have one stitch remaining in the round remove any eor marker k2tog each stitch repeat until you have 6 stitches remaining for both sizes with 6 stitches left cut a long length of yarn and slip through the remaining loops pulling the hat closed additional information the green sample knit was made using drops lima 65% wool 35% alpaca 50g/100m 60g used the black sample knit was made using drops merino extra fine 100% superwash merino 50g/105m 67g used the pattern has a lot of stretch and is designed to fit snugly hitchknits 2020
